Vaccinating children ages 5‚Äì11 is critical to slowing #COVID19's spread.

It is OK to get a flu shot and a #COVID19 vaccine on the same day, @CDCgov says.

Officials suggest getting them in different arms, or at least an inch apart if in the same arm. https://t.co/MjxDn7oq7p

"Consider something hidden amid all the other dysfunction that plagues us: fear of needles. ... Prepandemic research suggests that fear of needles may affect up to 25 percent of adults and may lead up to 16 percent of adults to skip or delay vaccinations." https://t.co/ApvV5whb08

‚ÄúLike COVID-19, the silent pandemic of antibiotic resistance requires global solutions so that all infections are treatable for everyone, everywhere,‚Äù write @Manica_AMR and Souha Kanj for @GHN_News. https://t.co/KE6c1t20yy

Remember: #COVID19 vaccines are very safe, and they are highly effective.

"Breakthrough cases" are not the norm, and there is strong evidence that fully vaccinated individuals who become infected tend to experience much less severe symptoms than unvaccinated individuals.
